brief.brief: The name of the table to extract the time zone value from, when processing the Alert.

detail.detail: The Table Name (tz.table.name) field contains the name of the file where the time zone (to be used in calculating the alert time) is stored.

Service Manager uses this field, along with the Unique Key Field Name (tz.table.field) field and the Unique Key Value (tz.table.match.field) field, in building the query to retrieve the record where the time zone (to be used in calculating the alert time) is stored. On the AlertDef display form, this field is labeled "Table name"
On the Time Zone tab of the AlertDef display format, this field is labeled "Unique field name in table".
For example, assume that the desired time zone is stored in the file as described:
Field name of the unique key to the file: timeZoneID
Value that uniquely identifies the record: "abcde"
Name of the field that stores the time zone: theTimeZone
To instruct Service Manager on how to retrieve this particular time zone, specify the following in the Time Zone tab of the AlertDef format:
Unique field name in table (Unique Key Field Name, tz.table.field): timeZoneID
Name of record to query for (Unique Key Value, tz.table.match.field): abcde
Field name containing time zone value (Time Zone Field Name, tz.table.tzfield): theTimeZone
